title: Histogram
description: A histogram is a graphical summary of the frequency distribution of a single variable. It displays the shape, center, and spread of a dataset by dividing the data range into bins and counting observations in each bin.

title: Scatter Plot
description: A scatter plot displays the relationship between two quantitative variables by plotting data points on a two-dimensional graph. It is used to identify patterns, trends, correlations, and outliers.

title: Mean
description: The arithmetic mean is the most common measure of location (central tendency). It is calculated as the sum of all observations divided by the number of observations.
